text: Seven of the 10 most valued listed companies added Rs 49,642.58 crore in market valuation last week, with HDFC Bank Ltd. stealing the show with maximum gain.Except Reliance Industries Ltd. (RIL), Tata Consultancy Services Ltd. (TCS) and Infosys Ltd., the other seven companies saw a rise in their market capitalisation (m-cap) for the week ended Friday.Among the gainers, HDFC Bank's m-cap surged the most by Rs 11,998.43 crore to Rs 3,95,547.46 crore. The valuation of ONGC Ltd. zoomed Rs 8,213.27 crore to Rs 2,39,083.17 crore and Indian Oil Corporation Ltd. (IOC) saw a jump of Rs 7,429.53 crore to Rs 2,13,586.98 crore. Hindustan Unilever Ltd.’s (HUL's) m-cap soared Rs 6,168.4 crore to Rs 2,02,301.76 crore and State Bank of India Ltd. (SBI) gained Rs 5,920.2 crore to Rs 2,34,739.82 crore. ITC Ltd. added Rs 5,162.64 crore to Rs 3,38,426.09 crore in its m-cap, while HDFC rose by Rs 4,750.11 crore to Rs 2,44,185.90 crore.On the other hand, TCS suffered a loss of Rs 7,704.38 crore to Rs 4,47,700.93 crore.RIL, the country's most valued firm, also saw an erosion of Rs 1,609.41 crore from its market valuation to Rs 4,53,495.92 crore. RIL, early last week, reclaimed its status as the country's most valued firm by m-cap after a gap of four years, replacing technology major TCS from the top position. Infosys' m-cap fell by Rs 987.69 crore to Rs 2,11,181.09 crore.In the ranking of top-10 firms, RIL stood at number one position followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, ITC, HDFC, ONGC, SBI, IOC, Infosys and HUL. Over the past week, the Sensex and Nifty gained 553.10 points (1.88 per cent) and 184.65 points (2.02 percent), respectively.
title: Seven Of Top 10 Companies Add Rs 49,642 Crore In Market Capitalisation
